title: Front Wheel - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Warning - Brakes - Do not allow brake calipers to hang on brake hose
Do not allow the brake caliper to hang on the brake hose as this may damage the hose.
Damaged hoses could cause brake failure leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
It is not necessary to disconnect the brake hoses.
Raise and support the front of the motorcycle to allow removal of the front wheel.
Detach and support the front brake calipers (see
Loosen the pinch bolts at the lower end of the right hand fork.
Working from the right hand side, release and remove the wheel spindle which is threaded into the left hand fork.
Remove the wheel, recovering the spacers from both sides.
Do not allow the wheel to rest on the brake disc as this may damage the disc leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
To prevent wheel and wheel bearing damage, ensure dirt and debris are not allowed to enter the wheel bearings.
Place the wheel on wooden blocks to prevent damage to the brake discs.
Thoroughly clean all components and inspect for wear or damage.
